Package com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight

Class ChainLight

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.Light
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.ChainLight
All Implemented Interfaces:
Disposable
public class ChainLight
extends Light
A light whose ray starting points are evenly distributed along a chain of vertices

Extends Light

  • Constructor Details

    • ChainLight

      public ChainLight​(RayHandler rayHandler, int rays, Color color, float distance, int rayDirection)
      Creates chain light without vertices, they can be added any time later
      Parameters:
      rayHandler - not null instance of RayHandler
      rays - number of rays - more rays make light to look more realistic but will decrease performance, can't be less than MIN_RAYS
      color - color, set to null to use the default color
      distance - distance of light
      rayDirection - direction of rays
      • 1 = left
      • -1 = right

    • ChainLight

      public ChainLight​(RayHandler rayHandler, int rays, Color color, float distance, int rayDirection, float[] chain)
      Creates chain light from specified vertices
      Parameters:
      rayHandler - not null instance of RayHandler
      rays - number of rays - more rays make light to look more realistic but will decrease performance, can't be less than MIN_RAYS
      color - color, set to null to use the default color
      distance - distance of light
      rayDirection - direction of rays
      • 1 = left
      • -1 = right
      chain - float array of (x, y) vertices from which rays will be evenly distributed

  • Method Details

    • debugRender

      public void debugRender​(ShapeRenderer shapeRenderer)
      Draws a polygon, using ray start and end points as vertices

    • attachToBody

      public void attachToBody​(Body body)
      Description copied from class: Light
      Attaches light to specified body
      Specified by:
      attachToBody in class Light
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations

    • attachToBody

      public void attachToBody​(Body body, float degrees)
      Attaches light to specified body with relative direction offset
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations
      degrees - directional relative offset in degrees

    • setDistance

      public void setDistance​(float dist)
      Sets light distance

      MIN value capped to 0.1f meter

      Actual recalculations will be done only on update() call

      Specified by:
      setDistance in class Light

    • setDirection

      Not applicable for this light type
      Specified by:

    • updateChain

      public void updateChain()
      Calculates ray positions and angles along chain. This should be called any time the number or values of elements changes in chain.
